publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-3407 Des McNulty: Earthquake in Kashmir—That the Parliament expresses its deepest sympathy for the victims of the earthquake affecting Kashmir and Pakistan’s North-West Frontier Province which took place on Saturday 8 October 2005; recognises that many families in Scotland will have lost relatives and friends as a result of the tragedy or are awaiting information about those who are missing; congratulates Islamic Relief and other charitable organisations on their swift response, and welcomes the steps taken by the UK Government to provide urgent assistance to the affected areas. Supported by: Sarah Boyack*, Scott Barrie*, Bill Butler*, Janis Hughes*, Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Mr Kenneth Macintosh*, Maureen Macmillan*, Michael McMahon*, Mr Duncan McNeil*, Patrick Harvie*, Karen Whitefield*, Murray Tosh*, Stewart Stevenson*, Nora Radcliffe*, Mike Pringle*, Dr Elaine Murray*, Ms Rosemary Byrne*, Ms Sandra White*, Margaret Jamieson*, Susan Deacon*, Frances Curran*, Margaret Mitchell*, John Home Robertson*, Paul Martin*, Bristow Muldoon*, Mr Jamie Stone*, Irene Oldfather*, Mr Charlie Gordon*, Phil Gallie*, Brian Adam*, Shiona Baird*, Christine May*, Marlyn Glen*, Pauline McNeill*, Jackie Baillie*, Kate Maclean*, Mrs Mary Mulligan*, Gordon Jackson*, Cathy Peattie*, Mr Brian Monteith*, Cathie Craigie*, Margaret Smith*, Elaine Smith*, Mr John Swinney*, Euan Robson*, Carolyn Leckie*, Fiona Hyslop*, Murdo Fraser*, Helen Eadie*, Mr Andrew Arbuckle*, Mr Frank McAveety*

S2M-3407 Earthquake in Kashmir (lodged on 10 October 2005) Marilyn Livingstone*, Trish Godman*, Tricia Marwick*, Robin Harper*, Mrs Margaret Ewing*, Mr Adam Ingram*, Chris Ballance*, Dennis Canavan*, Richard Baker*, Eleanor Scott*
S2M-3407 Earthquake in Kashmir (lodged on 10 October 2005) John Scott*, Karen Gillon*
S2M-3407 Earthquake in Kashmir (lodged on 10 October 2005) Donald Gorrie*

S2M-3407*#* Des McNulty: Eartquake in Kashmir—That the Parliament expresses its deepest sympathy for the victims of the earthquake affecting Kashmir and Pakistan’s North-West Frontier Province which took place on Saturday 8 October 2005; recognises that many families *in the west of Scotland and across Scotland as a whole* will have lost relatives and friends as a result of the tragedy or are awaiting information about those who are missing; congratulates Islamic Relief and other charitable organisations on their swift response, and welcomes the steps taken by the UK Government to provide urgent assistance to the affected areas.
S2M-3407# Earthquake in Kashmir (lodged on 10 October 2005) Tommy Sheridan*
S2M-3407# Earthquake in Kashmir (lodged on 10 October 2005) John Swinburne*
S2M-3407# Earthquake in Kashmir (lodged on 10 October 2005) Mr Mark Ruskell*

S2M-3407# Des McNulty: Earthquake in Kashmir—That the Parliament expresses its deepest sympathy for the victims of the earthquake affecting Kashmir and Pakistan’s North-West Frontier Province which took place on Saturday 8 October 2005; recognises that many families *in the west of Scotland and across Scotland as a whole* will have lost relatives and friends as a result of the tragedy or are awaiting information about those who are missing; congratulates Islamic Relief and other charitable organisations on their swift response, and welcomes the steps taken by the UK Government to provide urgent assistance to the affected areas. Supported by: Sarah Boyack, Scott Barrie, Bill Butler, Janis Hughes, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Mr Kenneth Macintosh, Maureen Macmillan, Michael McMahon, Mr Duncan McNeil, Patrick Harvie, Karen Whitefield, Murray Tosh, Stewart Stevenson, Nora Radcliffe, Mike Pringle, Dr Elaine Murray, Ms Rosemary Byrne, Ms Sandra White, Margaret Jamieson, Susan Deacon, Frances Curran, Margaret Mitchell, John Home Robertson, Paul Martin, Bristow Muldoon, Mr Jamie Stone, Irene Oldfather, Mr Charlie Gordon, Phil Gallie, Brian Adam, Shiona Baird, Christine May, Marlyn Glen, Pauline McNeill, Jackie Baillie, Kate Maclean, Mrs Mary Mulligan, Gordon Jackson, Cathy Peattie, Mr Brian Monteith, Cathie Craigie, Margaret Smith, Elaine Smith, Mr John Swinney, Euan Robson, Carolyn Leckie, Fiona Hyslop, Murdo Fraser, Helen Eadie, Mr Andrew Arbuckle, Mr Frank McAveety, Marilyn Livingstone, Trish Godman, Tricia Marwick, Robin Harper, Mrs Margaret Ewing, Mr Adam Ingram, Chris Ballance, Dennis Canavan, Richard Baker, Eleanor Scott, Alex Neil, John Scott, Karen Gillon, Donald Gorrie, Tommy Sheridan, John Swinburne, Mr Mark Ruskell Motions and amendments which have attracted additional support
S2M-3407# Earthquake in Kashmir (lodged on 10 October 2005) Lord James Douglas-Hamilton* Contents An A B C D E F G H I J
